intro: Micranthes plantaginea, commonly known as the blue-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to blue. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and produces numerous tiny seeds in its fruit. Micranthes plantaginea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in suitable conditions.
